segments.text: Hey Susan , what are you coming as this year ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yeah ... for Halloween ! We have a big office party tomorrow evening . There's a prize for best costume !
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Um ... I have to confess , I haven't given it much thought . I'm from China and Halloween really isn't celebrated there .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Really ! You don't have some kind of Chinese ghost festival ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Oh ... Sure . We have an entire month ! In traditional Chinese culture , Ghost Month is a period when the door between this world and beyond opens up and ghosts come back to earth for a visit .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Cool ! A whole month ! What do you do during that month ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , people sometimes set off firecrackers , some people burn paper money as an offering and many people go to a temple to burn incense.Mainly though , you need to feed the ghosts because they're hungry .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yeah ... we set up tables with food , fruit and drinks and offer that to the hungry ghosts .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: And then later everyone eats the food ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes ! How did you guess that ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: It makes sense , right ? Who else is going to eat it ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But no dressing up like ghosts , right ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No ! So ... is Halloween essentially the same thing as ghost month ?
segments.speaker: S2
